actions.committee: House Committee on Foreign Affairs (Subsequently: International Relations)
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Foreign Affairs (Subsequently: International Relations).

official_title: Resolution directing the Secretary of State to provide information, and answer certain questions, relating to American policy toward Chile between 1964 and 1973.

summary.text: Directs the Secretary of State to furnish to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs, within 10 days, specified information on Chile relating to the following matters: (1) the 1964 elections; (2) the 1970 elections; (3) the scheme to bribe the Chilean Congress; (4) the anti-Allende media campaign in 1970; (5) the expenditure of $5,000,000 to support an anti-Allende campaign in the media following the 1970 elections; (6) the municipal elections in 1973; (7) the expenditure of $1,000,000 in 1973 for the purpose of assisting groups opposed to Allende; (8) which members of Congress were informed of these operations; (9) which members of the State Department participated in these operations; (10) economic sanctions employed by the U.S. Government in Chile; and (11) the existence of an interagency economic policy group to formulate American economic policy towards Chile.

titles.title: Resolution directing the Secretary of State to provide information, and answer certain questions, relating to American policy toward Chile between 1964 and 1973.
